newsitem.title: USA: Calif Gov seeks $100 mln of bond funds for schools.
newsitem.headline: Calif Gov seeks $100 mln of bond funds for schools.

text.p: California Gov. Pete Wilson on Wednesday urged a state panel to allocate $100 million from a $3 billion school bond measure to reduce public school class sizes.

In a letter to the State Allocation Board, which was to meet later on Wednesday, Wilson said an allocation of $100 million from March's Proposition 203 could allow for the purchase of 2,500 portable classrooms.
California voters in March approved Proposition 203, a $3 billion bond to upgrade and construct classrooms and other school facilities.

"While I realize that there are competing demands on these funds, I strongly urge you to allocate $100 million to further enhance our initiative to reduce class sizes from 30 to 20 students in kindergarten through third grade," Wilson said.
